pr_title: Add log manager helper to get logger for a component

timeline.bodyText: should this be ~root/logs? or will the log config go into /logs by default?
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: The log config will go to /logs by default.
replies.author: nikkhilmuthye

timeline.bodyText: when we use the logger we are normally passing the class, so have an override for the class when naming the logger
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: also, don't we want an override that takes a GreengrassService? Shouldn't that be the whole point?
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: I was thinking that we would use the function in the UserLambdaService and set the logger there by using getComponentLogger(String name) function with the lambda name.
replies.author: nikkhilmuthye

replies.bodyText:
Ignore lambda. This applies to all services.
I want this class to perform the subscription in order to reconfigure when logging configs change. So it should get the service instance so that it can then call getConfig() to get the service's config and subscribe to whatever logging topics we have
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: what's this about? The root doesn't have "parameters"
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText:
I think this PR will add parameters in the kernel config https://github.com/aws/aws-greengrass-kernel/pull/513/files
This is where we will add the root logger config.
replies.author: nikkhilmuthye

replies.bodyText: In that case, your lookup here is wrong because this is looking under the config root instead of under the nucleus as a service's topics.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText:
let's remove the interfaces that we won't be using. I suggest that we use only
getComponentLogger(Class<?> clazz, GreengrassService service)
which will do make a logger with name clazz.getName() and filename service.getServiceName()
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: I think the logger name should be service.getServiceName() cause we need it to be unique for different services. We cache the logger based on their names. But will remove the other functions.
replies.author: nikkhilmuthye

replies.bodyText: Hmm, the logger name is typically the class name, but I suppose you're right. So just have getComponentLogger(GreengrassService service) which creates a logger with getServiceName as the logger and file name.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.message: Keep only one function which will be used.

timeline.bodyText: this is very wordy when it doesn't really need to be. I'd just call the Topics as Logging. Make sure to change it to Topics it shouldn't be a singular Topic
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: And use the same name for the kernel's topics too
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText:
Right now its not implemented yet. So my point of adding this was just to have the skeleton code. Will make the change in the next PR when that is implemented.
Also, the name should be ComponentLoggerConfig to keep in the same line as the dependencies and other topics in the component recipe.
replies.author: nikkhilmuthye

replies.bodyText: That's not how the topics are named inside the kernel. Inside it is just dependencies, etc. And "LoggerConfig" is gross, none of the other names are "config"
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Is it under parameters or not? If it is new top level thing in the recipe, then it shouldn't be under parameters anyway
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: It will be under parameters for the kernel config. But yes. will remove the lookup in the service since it will be a top level thing in the component recipe.
